question: I don't actually draw all the animation, no. We have sweatshop workers who couldn't get jobs at Nike doing that. Guide...? I - I have to, uh, check in with my doctor. DO- OCCCC!! Hey, Doc. Come here. There's something really cool I want to show you. See these doors? The cool thing is, you go out ...they close...you can't get back in!
answer: You want to leave? But Stu - you're a big hit! Everyone loves you!

question: They don't love me. They love Monkeybone.
answer: It was you who got the standing O. It was you drawing on the belly over there...

question: That was especially Monkeybone. Come on, Doc, I don't want to be stuck here with this bunch of media creeps. I just want to be us. Home. Alone! I have something I have to give you.
answer: Can't you give it to me later?

question: Yeah, I could, but the thing is, if later got here sooner, it would be...better.
answer: Sorry, Julie - won't be a minute. Now Stu - I know you don't like the idea, but you really ought to talk to these guys -

question: Julie and I - we were just gonna go...
answer: Go? There's a potload of money here, pal. You got three major toy companies...you got the guys from Burger God over here...

question: Burger God. The ones that found the pig hair in the french fries?
answer: Never proven. They're ready to pop for a pre- emptive endorsement. Kids love Burger God -

question: Herb, it's too much. It's all out of hand.
answer: Do you know what kind of opportunity you have here? You gotta strike. I'm talking mansions. Lamborghinis. Champagne for mouthwash when you brush your teeth!

question: I don't want to be rich. It's just a trap!
answer: Being rich is not a trap. That is a dirty lie perpetuated by rich people to keep the failures from killing them.

question: Herb. I have to go.
answer: Why?

question: I got the ring. Tonight's the night, Herb. Tonight's the night.
answer: Oh my God...you're proposing?

question: My life was totally crappy, Herb, and she... fixed it. She made me happy. Which I'd never been. She loves me the way I am - right now.
answer: ...In some weird way I respect that. Okay then. If I get you out of here - you pop the question - tonight. Or else. Get me? They're just prototypes...take 'em home and look at 'em before you say no... If you could just hold on a minute or two, we're expecting a couple more trucks. Okay, okay! You're a beautiful couple. Go.

question: Look at this! He won't let us leave!
answer: Who?

question: The monkey!! He's everywhere! He'll take over both our lives if we let him.
answer: Stu - stop it. That monkey is good luck. You thought him up, and everybody loves him, and he's probably going to make you rich. So relax! Enjoy it!

question: I'm trying. It's weird, that's all. I never had any good luck, until I met you...what if it's all just another bad dream?
answer: What's the "bad" part?

question: That damn monkey is everywh-- Did we just - hit something?
answer: I don't think so.

question: Are you okay?? Hey! Are you guys all right in there? That stupid monkey banner! It fell on my windshield - it practically killed us all! God, Julie, if anything had happened to you -
answer: I'm fine, baby. We're all okay. We were lucky.

question: I'd better go report this...
answer: Dad's car? STU!!

question: Operator? I want to report an accident.
answer: Stu? I'm here, baby. It's me. It's Julie. I love you. You're gonna be okay, baby, I promise - I'm here, baby. I won't leave you...

question: Hello? Anybody? - Am I dead? Help me. Please. There's animals. They - Chasing me - animals - horrible -
answer: Animals? What kind of animals? Yeah, I know - Picasso. Guernica, right? That's what everybody says - although personally, I don't see the resemblance. What are you drinking?

question: Uhh - martini?
answer: Olive or eyeball?

question: Olive. - Where exactly am I?
answer: Dark Town. Land of nightmares. I'm Bull.

question: Stu Miley.
answer: Yeah, I've seen a few of your dreams. You're quite a celebrity down here. I told you, it's the land of nightmares. Same on every channel...all the stuff people dream, after they have the extra anchovies.

question: Jeez, it all looks like bad late-night cable.
answer: Sad commentary, huh? I beg your pardon?

question: I didn't say anything. I was, uh, just getting ready to leave...
answer: Yo, Jumbo. We got us some kind of ventriloquist here.

question: I'm a doctor too. I know this man's brain -
answer: Now don't pick a fight. I'm staying over.

question: Oh, poor Buster. He hasn't been fed in a day and a half. Let me get some food...
answer: Special occasion?

question: I don't know. I guess it was...
answer: Don't get all poignant. We're keeping this bottle on ice. When he comes around you're going to need it. Who did this?

question: Stu. That was right about the time we met.
answer: When he first came in to the sleep lab?

question: Yeah...before your time.
answer: Jesus, honey...he always joked about you curing him, but I never realized what you cured him from.

question: He hadn't gotten a good night's sleep in years. The nightmares would wake him up, and he'd start right in painting...
answer: How do you get from here - to there?

question: Switch hands.
answer: What?

question: I'm serious. It was bicameral disjunction - right brain and left brain out of balance. He was a rightie, so I made him switch the pencil to his left hand. Just to see what'd come out.
answer: Monkeybone?

question: Left-handed, he was funny. He'd been doing all this scary, intense work...then he found out he could draw this stuff, and make me laugh, and he liked that. And then the nightmares just...stopped.
answer: Wow - two guys in the same brain. - Which one did you fall in love with?

question: I've put a ton of work into that boy, Alice. I am not going to let him get away from me. Kimmy...?
answer: Oh, Julie...my poor Stu...my poor baby brother...

question: When'd you get in?
answer: An hour ago. I tried to prepare myself, but I didn't know he would be like, like this. I can't even bear to look at him... How about you? You're okay?

question: I'm fine, Kimmy. Fine.
answer: I had so much I always wanted to say to him. At least he had a chance to give you the ring.

question: The ring...
answer: Grandmama's ring. The engagement ring. He asked me to send it to him -

question: Grandmama's ring. The engagement ring. He asked me to send it to him -
answer: Vital signs have stabilized. That's good.

question: Can you give us a realistic sense of my brother's chances?
answer: He's held on this far. We can't do much but wait and see.

question: But these...machines are what's keeping him alive, is that right?
answer: At the moment, yes.

question: Can you give me a realistic idea...of how long this is going to last?
answer: Comas are unpredictable. He could wake up today, tomorrow, a month from now...

question: Honey, I have to clarify this. The thing is, Dr. Edelstein, my brother has an absolute horror of doctors - hospitals - needles - all of it -
answer: Kimmy, he doesn't know what's going on. He doesn't even know he's in a -

question: Please, Julie. This is not easy for me. Our father took a long time to die. A long time. It just about killed us all. And Stu and I made a pact that when our time came - we wouldn't let it drag out.
answer: It's too soon even to - talk about that!

question: I'm sick of martinis. I'm sick of the waiting, and the carnival rides, and watching people's nightmares. And of course, I need not add -
answer: Thank you, thank you for that very modest We've got a special dedication tonight. This one's from my ever-lovin' boss, Mr. Stu Mopey - I mean Miley - and we're sendin' it up to a very special lady in the land of the living. Yes, I do mean Julie - the beautiful Miss Julie - who, if she has a brain in her head, is shacked up right now with some good-lookin' doc she met in the E.R.! JUST KIDDING, BUDDY! Because if we know anything about Miss Julie, we know she is faithful, loyal, and true. Even if her boyfriend is an eggplant. Which is why we're dedicating...this very special tune...to her. Jumbo? MAH baby does the Hanky-Panky! UNHH! MAH baby does the Hanky-Panky! UNHH!

question: You have humiliated me in public for the last
answer: I doubt that. Besides, I can't help myself. I'm just a figment of your imagination.

question: Then you can learn to act normally. I had to!
answer: Aw, come on. You know you love me. You're a masochistic pain freak. You gotta love me.

question: I am not. And I don't gotta.
answer: You are too! Mooning over Julie when we could both be gettin' some o' this fine local action. It's not like she's gonna know. Out of town, under five minutes, and in a coma don't count.

question: Sorry. The women here aren't my type. Most of them aren't even my species.
answer: Hellooooooooo, Kitty.

question: I'm not so special. I'm just - kind of -
answer: Come on, pal! It was a compliment! You'da done the same if you had the equipment!

question: THAT DOES IT! BACK IN THE PACK!
answer: FORGET IT! NO WAY! I'M NOT GETTING - I'm reportin' this to my union!!

question: What union?
answer: The sidekicks' union! Me, Tonto, and Robin the Boy Wonder. You top bananas better watch your ass! DIVE! DIVE!! I left my phone number in your undies. Try not to lose it in traffic.

question: Sorry, Kitty! I'll be right back after I choke my monkey.
answer: Him. Whew. About time!

question: No. No. Not him. He's ninety. He's practically dead already. How come he goes back and I stay here?
answer: Maybe he wanted to pick out his own casket?

question: HEY!! HEY, YOU!! He got an E-ticket. Where's mine? When do I get
answer: Stu? Stu? Let's not disturb the nice Reaper.

question: I've been stuck down here for months. Somebody had better start paying attention, or I'm gonna - I'm gonna kick ass!
answer: Let's not kick the nice Reaper's ass.

question: Say, have you seen Mr. Hypnos?
answer: Hyp? He was here a while ago. Aren't you Stu Miley? The nightmare guy? I heard you were going to be here tonight. This is so cool! You fat slob! Watch what you're doing! Come on, Stu. Let's go where the real fun is.

question: Wow. Live feed, huh?
answer: You bet. Hyp gets all the best stuff before it goes out to the theatres.

question: Sorry.
answer: Shh! There's a new one just starting.

question: That - that's me. What is this? Who's dreaming this?? Julie?? JULIE!!
answer: Stu!! What are you doing? Chill out!!

question: Mr. Hypnos - sir - I needed to talk to you -
answer: Wait a minute. Stu Miley, right? Boys and girls ...Mr. Stu Miley, in the house!

question: Mr. Hypnos, I saw a dream. My girlfriend was having it. She dreamed they were pulling the plug on me. She was watching me die.
answer: Uh huh. And?

question: Well, I have to get a message to her. I have to let her know I'm okay. Until I can get out of here... ...which is actually what I wanted to talk to you about. See, I've been here three months -
answer: Kid - didn't they tell you about this party?

question: Tell me what?
answer: It's a special kind of party. A farewell party. Do you...get what I'm saying?

question: Farewell? You mean - you mean I'm - I'M GOING HOME! I'M WAKING UP! HEY, EVERYBODY! I think I...I'm about to... Am I mistaken, or don't I get to... Is there some...
answer: Y'see, Stu, as I understand it, you made this pact with your sister...no life support?

question: Mr. Hypnos, you run this place. I'm begging you. There's gotta be something I can do.
answer: Stu, I like you personally, I admire your work, but I'm just the God of Sleep. This is Death's bailiwick.

question: Maybe you could talk to Death!
answer: Me? Me, go crawling to Death? My friend, it will be a cold, cold day in Las Vegas, Nevada, before I go crawling to that piece of - Now Death is not what you would call a people person, like me. Death is a putz - and I should know. I'm his little brother.

question: You're Death's brother?
answer: Oh yeah. Mr. By-the-book, Stick-Up-the-Ass, My- Way-or-the-Highway Death. Believe me - over the course of eternity, you get pretty damned tired of that schtick.

question: Fate worse than death! Well, it's been real, boss, but I gotta go buff up my resum. ANYBODY HERE NEED A FIGMENT?
answer: Fine! Don't put yourself out. I'll go to the land of Death alone.

question: Stu, you have my absolute confidence. - DEAD MAN! DEAD MAN WALKING!!
answer: I've got one chance to get back to Julie, and I'm gonna take it - with or without you.

question: Hey. Aren't you gonna talk me into it?
answer: No. Goodbye. Thanks for nothing.

question: You gotta talk me into it. You'll screw up on your own. I mean, a guy's gotta have a sidekick. For moral support! Wisecracks - snappy banter - It's the land of Death, Stu, the Land of Death! Don't go in there without your comedy relief!!
answer: All right. You can come.

question: OH, THANK YOU! THANK YOU! TH-- Something went very, very wrong here.
answer: Now we just gotta figure out how to get there.

question: Is that what they call "death with dignity"? Two words for you, my friend
answer: He's taking her to the land of Death, right? So all we've gotta do is...hitch a ride! Stop shaking! I'll protect you.

question: Oh, sure. Mr. Action Hero! Why couldn't I be Arnold Schwarzenegger's figment?
answer: Where'd he go??

question: It's nightmare juice. Julie and I were on the team that learned to synthesize it. If those charts are right, Stu's swimming in the stuff. Are you thinking we can decrease the levels?
answer: No. I want to give him more. I want to give him a massive dose.

question: That's not going to stop his nightmare -
answer: I don't want to stop the nightmare, Hutch. I want to crank it up. I want to take it right off the charts. I want to scare him awake. All right! We have a plan. Let's move!

question: You know, Julie, even if this works - which it probably won't - that stuff is tricky. You don't know what it'll do to his brain.
answer: What'll it do if they pull the plug?

question: Last Days of Pompeii...now there was a Great Moment in Death. I can't believe - oh, man, I - SINATRA!! Do you know how long I've been waiting for this? Okay, okay, send 'em in. Jeez. YOU!!! You're the customer, okay? You're about to die. It's a big occasion. A formal occasion. And as you shuffle off this mortal coil, the last thing your eyes behold is a Grim Reaper covered with... What the hell is that?? ...What?? Well - whatever it is - you get that shroud to the dry cleaner ASAP! Now where were we? Oh, wait. Says here he's supposed to recover. Take this to Dark Town. Sad to say, he's gonna live another forty years. Sorry. Nobody said this job would be easy.
answer: Say, Death, just out of curiosity, could we maybe swap jobs with that other guy? See, we've been meaning to drop in on Dark Town - I mean I've been meaning to...

question: ...I beg your pardon?
answer: I got relatives there. I...EEP!!

question: Now what were you saying? I'd like to have a word with you in private. IMPOSTORS!! GET 'EM!! HYPNOS! That little twerp! He's the one who put you up to this!
answer: Yowie.

question: Head. HEAD!!
answer: Stu...Stu... There's a thing here! There's a switch! Stu...LOOK!

question: This ain't my nightmare!
answer: You saved my life, Monkeybone. I never would've made it without you.

question: Move it. We got exactly five minutes left.
answer: It's just...now that I'm leaving, I feel like there's lots of things I haven't said. Who's gonna look out for you? Are you gonna be okay when I'm gone?

question: Oh, don't you worry. I'll be fine.
answer: You've been a hell of a figment, pal. I sure wish I could take you home with me.

question: Awwww. Worried about my feelings, are you? Well, there's a new twist.
answer: Don't joke around, little buddy. I mean it. I really do love y--

question: Love you too. Boss.
answer: Stop! Monkeybone! Please!! NO! DON'T YOU UNDERSTAND?? HE'S GOT MY E-TICKET!

question: Who are y-- WHAT DO YOU WANT?? Alfred Hitchcock??
answer: Gotta move fast in this crowd, or you'll starve. Here you go, pal. Have some popcorn.

question: What is this stuff?
answer: They feed us the slops from the Morpheum Theatre. You hope for Jujubes, settle for goobers. - I'm Steve. Steve King.

question: Sorry, Steve, maybe next time. And how's our new guest settling in - ?
answer: YOU SET ME UP!!

question: Easy, pal! I was coming to congratulate you. It ain't easy snatching one of those E-tickets. Steve here was the last guy to pull it off, and that musta been, what, 25 years ago...?
answer: Why'd you do it? What'd I ever do to you?!?

question: It's simple, Stu. We need nightmares - lots of 'em. So whenever we can swing it, we send a guy up to stimulate the flow...a nightmare maker! Like Steve here. Poe. Rasputin...we've been doing this all the way back to Atilla and Genghis Khan!
answer: But why me? Why'd you pick on me??

question: The monkey, of course. It was his idea.
answer: Monkeybone...!?

question: Nobody wants to be a sidekick, Stu. So one day he comes to us - he's got a proposition. We help him get your body...in return he gives us all the nightmares we want.
answer: You're nuts! I'm a comic strip artist! What's he gonna do - draw really scary cartoons??

question: Kimmy. Chill. We've still got a pact. If anything ever happens to you, I'll be right there to return the favor. So drive carefully! From now on.
answer: Welcome home. Oh, baby, I can't believe you're back.

question: Home sweet home, huh? Actually, I was expecting something a little swankier. How much loot does old Stu rake in, anyway? Meaning me, of course. I'm referring to myself. You have to assume Monkeybone would be a pretty lucrative franchise...
answer: Baby? Why don't you just...rest on the sofa for a minute. I'll be right back. Here's to a bottle...we should have opened... three months ago.

question: Bitchin' good cake.
answer: Stu, are you...feeling okay?

question: Sure. Why?
answer: You're acting kind of...odd. Buster! Look who's here!

question: Oh shit, the cake! Mine. Get back! MINE!!
answer: What are you watching?

question: Ohhh, nothing.
answer: You sure this is...medically advisable?

question: Got a doctor on duty.
answer: Well. As long as it's okay with Monkeybone - Oh, God!! Baby! Are you -

question: ...Kitty?!?
answer: I'm so sorry, Stu. I wanted to tell you what was going on. I really, really liked you.

question: Kitty...my situation is really not important. The thing is, my girlfriend is now living with, and possibly engaged to, a demented monkey.
answer: You're such a beautiful man. Look at you - stuck in this place, and only thinking of her.

question: Listen to me! Is there any way I can warn her what Monkeybone is up to??
answer: No! Give me a moment. Just to look at him. Oh, Stu. Oh, my sweet, sweet Stu.

question: Priceless! Priceless! This stuff just kills me!
answer: I'm heading in to work, baby. Are you sure you'll be okay?

question: Oh yeah. There's just one thing I don't get. "Monkeybone Creator Awakens from Coma" that's a big story! That's front page news! But I can't find a word of coverage in this stinkin' rag! Hey. Don't I have a TV show?
answer: They only made the one episode. They've shown it about nineteen times.

question: I need a new PR guy. Yes, being in a coma taught Stu Miley a thing or two about life. Buckle your seat belts, for one. But seriously, Stu Miley is a different man today. I'm much homier. And speaking of which, here's the light of my life, the pert and saucy Miss Julie McElroy.
answer: I had to park two blocks away. Is something -

question: Eep! Friggin' Hypnos. I'll show him... Hey, I'd love to, baby, but...it'd put me in hot water. Tell you what, angel. When you get out, give me a call...
answer: Stu? Is that you? Where did you go?

question: Me? Nowhere. I was asleep.
answer: Baby, don't lie. I know you went out.

question: Not me. Nope. You must've been dreaming.
answer: You're wearing a topcoat, Stu. - Where are your pants?

question: Well, Miss Smarty, if I didn't go out, I wouldn't need any pants. Now would I?
answer: What's the matter?

question: I think it's a pig hair. How much is McDonald's offering?
answer: Less. Oh, here's something. The city zoo is kicking off a fund-raising campaign. They wonder if you'd be willing to appear at a benefit.

question: How much?
answer: Well, nothing. It's a benefit. But we could probably get People and Entertainment Tonight to cover it.

question: I get it. We could give the public the impression that we were doing something... charitable. Brilliant!!
answer: And last...you remember Bill here, from the Bazoom Toy Company? He's got a little something I think you'll like.

question: Let's not think about dogs. Let's think about pussycats. Meeowwwwwwrrrr.... Shh! You'll need it when you're traveling. Don't ask where I got it.
answer: You can't do this! You'll get in trouble!

question: You're the only true-hearted man I ever met. You find a way back to that girl of yours and make her happy.
answer: How am I gonna get past the guards?

question: I'll worry about the guards. Go. Just go.
answer: Thanks, Kitty, I'll never forget you for th-- I'll really...never...forget you.

question: Hello? Oh, Hutch - what?
answer: The Nightmare Juice! It's gone! Somebody switched it for a beaker of grape Kool-Aid!!

question: Kool-Aid!? But who'd would want to - Okay. Call the police. I'll be right over. The technical name is Oneirix. It's an enzyme. It's present in the brains of -
answer: Holy shit...the pants. The janitor found a pair of torn-up pants. It was the same night the monkey tipped her cage over. Remember that, Julie?

question: Now, if I may ask - what kind of idiot sneaks into the Land of Death twice?
answer: You're mad at me. Great. You have every right to be. But we're both mad at Dark Town. We're both mad at Hypnos.

question: Oh, sure. Now you're gonna tell me it was all his idea. You were completely innocent -
answer: I'm not going to tell you that. I wanted that E- ticket. I wanted it so bad I'd stare you right in the face to get it - and I'd do the same again.

question: Why??
answer: I have a girl up there. And I never - I should've - I just want to tell her I love her.

question: I'm a simple man. I'm just doing my job. I enjoy
answer: Death, I'm trying to make things right. Take my soul. Turn me into a paper doll. But give me just one lousy hour.

question: Well - you'd need a body. If it wasn't for that comic strip of yours, I wouldn't be doing this. But a good chuckle is darned hard to come by. That one where Monkeybone stole the soap cake out of the urinal - I thought I would die.
answer: Coming from you, that's quite a compliment.

question: De nada. Now, come here...bend over...before I change my mind.
answer: Bend over?

question: As emcee I want to thank you all for joining us at this swingin' bash...it's a special night for the birds, and the lions, and the monkeys, but it's also a special night for - - this monkey. And it's special because of a very special lady. Her name is - Julie McElroy. Just kiddin', Julie. Stand up. And to make this special night extra-special, I'd like to do a special number...especially for you. I am just a Monkey Man! I'm glad you are a monkey...woman...too. We'll hop a plane tonight. An island ceremony. An Abba Dabba honeymoon!
answer: It looks so...new.

question: It is new. Why wouldn't it be new?
answer: But the heirloom ring. Your grandmother's ring...

question: Please. Where did you take that man...? Who are you? Why did you say those things?
answer: Oh, Doc, it's all a mixup. We were in the land of death. He stole my e-ticket. That's how he got my body, see? All they had left for me was this corpse! Don't walk away, Doc! He's only here to give people nightmares!

question: BUSTER?!? Stu...how?
answer: I had to come back, Julie. I had to give you this. I meant to give it to you before. The night we crashed. I was so happy, Julie, I...try to remember me like that, okay? Not like this.

question: What's wrong?
answer: I'm crying too. I just don't have any tears. I'm all dried up.

question: I mean it this time. Back in the pack.
answer: Stu...I can explain...I was sick of being a figment, see? It's awful being a figment. It's degrading! And I never really wanted to give people nightmares. I just told 'em that so they'd help me get a body.

question: Yeah - my body. Back in the pack, you simian shitbird!
answer: Laugh, damn you...laugh at the sidekick...the happy little monkey. He doesn't have any feelings. He's just a figment of your immagination! GIMME THAT GODDAM BAT!

question: Hey. Where's Monkeybone?
answer: Back in your head, where he belongs. No offense, Stu, but on your own you're kinda vanilla. I didn't want to send you back without him.

question: Back? You're sending me back?
answer: It's irregular, but...I just love that strip of yours. I figure I'll take the "Family Circus" guy instead.

question: Death! Thank you!
answer: Thank me next time you see me. Ohhhh, Hypnos??
